Reviews.Title: “Still OK- but I'll look for other options on the next trip.”
Reviews.Author: BigTool
Reviews.Content: My review from March, 2011 still, mostly, holds true. This is dog-friendly hotel close to the interstate that we've stayed at a few times during the past several years. We had no problems with the most recent stay although the room rate was bit higher. In March our room rate was < $75. At that rate the hotel value/quality was above-average. For the most recent stay, the rate was nearly $100. Summer rates perhaps? At that rate, though, the value/quality is just average. I would stay here again, but I'm definitely going to check out other nearby options.

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap, dog-friendly and just off the Interstate.”
Reviews.Author: BigTool
Reviews.Content: The above caption pretty much sums it all up. We needed a cheap, dog-friendly hotel close to the interstate. We had stayed here about 2-3 years ago and had no problem with staying there again. Compared to other hotels in that price range (room rate + dog fee + tax < $75) it was above-average. I really liked that I made an advance reservation asking for a specific type of room (because of the dog) and got a room that matched my request exactly. I didn't notice any problems with the cleanliness of our room or of the hotel grounds and everything in our room worked properly. On the negative side, I thought the bed's comfort was so-so, but my wife thought it was rather uncomfortable. I skipped the breakfast buffet because there weren't any "healthy" options. Ironically, I went to "Long's Bakery" about 2 miles west on Southport Ave. I figured that if I was going to eat poorly, I might as well eat some fresh bakery donuts rather than store-bought boxed donuts.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: frugalmommie22
Reviews.Content: My co worker and I called back in at the end of April to make reservations for our week long trip to Indiana for a work conference. We asked BEFORE we arrived if the rooms had microwaves, refrigerators, internet and a pool. The man we spoke with ( who had a thick accent so I am unsure of the name) was Mike or Nick. Anyways, I was told YES, they have those things. We booked the room. On July 19th we arrived in Indianapolis and found the hotel. First of all, it's in the same parking lot as another hotel, the parking lot is awful. We parked and got our room. When we first entered the lobby, it didn't look ANYTHING like the beatiful photos on the website. We got our room key and went up to the room. First we noticed the smell, either moldy, or smoky or something. Then we noticed that there was no refrig. or microwave! The room wasn't the most pleasant, but we didn't stick around to find out anything more. We headed down to the lobby and asked about the microwave and refrig. They said they never told me the rooms had that and that there was nothing they could do about it. They said the King Bed room would have a microwave...but then I would have to share a bed with a co worker!!! Duh! Also, they would charge me more for the KING room. I started calling other hotels. Thankfully, We found a wonderful, very friendly hotel that had a room for the week. We "checked out" 20 minutes after we "checked in" from Quality Inn. The only good thing is that they promised not to charge my credit card and as of now, ( 10 days later) they haven't charged it. I would NOT recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't normally stay here, but they take pets”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: Beggers can't be choosers when you're traveling with pets, but when the Country Inn across the parking lot turned us away because of our dog (which we had mentioned in our reservation), this place worked fine as a backup. It's not the greatest motel, but it's was half the price of the Country Inn across the parking lot. And since all we needed was a bed for a stop-over, it worked fine. This is not a place I would recommend for multiple nights. But if you're looking for a bed right off the highway at the "Crossroads of America" it works.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: jedMidwest
Reviews.Content: Rude Mng. "Nick", double charged for room, rms. were filthy with dried blood on lightswitch, cob webs, stained sheets and blankets. Breakfast was horrible, except for the store bought doughnuts. Couldn't swim in the pool for the dead bugs and all the chlorine. Threatened to call the cops to get a refund for the double charge was the only way of getting $ back. Stay away, pay extra for something else. Oh Good Note-Bed and pillows were soft.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away dirty and fleas!”
Reviews.Author: hdavisccs
Reviews.Content: The hotel has fleas stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mom*of*skiers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because our rental home was not ready and it is a pet friendly hotel. We needed 2 rooms due to the size of our party, and they both were disgusting. The walls are dirty, the one room had food on the wall, the other one had some sort of make up smudged on the wall in the sink area, which I was able to wipe off, housekeeping didn't bother. My husband noticed one of the sheets on the beds wasn't on all the way and when he went to fix it, the mattress pad had a giant hand towel sized yellow stain on it---nasty!!!! The dresser in one room was missing handles and the chair had dirt on the arm rests, it appears they never cleaned them. The last straw was the yellow and brown stained grout around the toilet in the bathroom of the 2nd room. Not to mention the moldy grout in front of the showers in both rooms. I have never stayed at a place so dirty. The wallpaper in the hallways was torn in several places or had gotten wet and did not stick to the walls any longer. If this is a franchise hotel, it is very clear the owner could care less about cleanliness or updating the hotel. When my hubby demanded a refund, a roach walked across the lobby. The clerk acted appalled, but I can only guess this is a regular occurence here. I feel bad writing such a poor review but this place deserves it in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “gym traveler”
Reviews.Author: gymtraveler305
Reviews.Content: Indianapolis, Indiana Quality Inn & Suites. 4345 Southport Crossing Way We stayed at the Quality Inn & Suites the night of February 8th 2008. We stayed there because it was one of the host hotels for the gymnastic meet being held on the 8,9 and 10 of February 2008. When we arrived there around 8pm we checked in and we were assigned a room, room103. The room was to be a non smoking King suite. When we entered the room the smell from old cigarette smoke could knock you over and the suite had one bed and two chairs. We complained to the front desk and the person behind the desk stated that " I forgot we took one of the beds out". We were then sent to a different suite, room 303. When we entered the room everything appeared to be ok. The carpet was a little dirty, but it got worst. The bath tub had two live spiders with spider webs in it. I killed the spiders, so we could use the shower. I then went to turn on the television, and it did not work. I called down to the desk and talked to a male employee and asked if the television could be fixed? He replied "he could not fix or replace the television but we could check out and stay at a different hotel." He then said "I can put you in another room" which would have been our third room. I asked to speak to a manager he replied there is not one on duty. We booked this room in November 2007, because the other hotels in the area were booked up due to the gymnastic meet. We had little choice but to stay. I am so glad we traveled with our own blankets an pillows because four of the six pillows in the room were to dirty to use. One of the pillows had a big orange red stain on it along with a long black hair. The other dirty pillows had black spots all over them, it looked like dried black mold. I then pulled out the sofa sleeper. There were no sheets or blankets for the mattress anywhere in the room, and the mattress was filthy. So the sleeper could not be used. Due to the filth we were afraid to use the rooms blankets and pillows so we used our own. At that point we called the corporate office and spoke with a very nice friendly person that went out or her way to make us feel happy. The person from the corporate office advised that the corporate office would be contacting us by February 12, 2008. Corporate has not contacted us as of the 14th. On the 14th of February we received a letter from the Indianapolis Quality Inn & Suites. The letter stated I apoligize for the problems you experienced and appreciate the comments so that immediate changes can be made. After our experience at this hotel I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: HoosierMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days during my husband's business trip. Very quiet location, close to shopping, restaurants,and I65. Continental breakfast was great. Staff at front desk very pleasant and accommodating. But, if you have a problem with cleanliness, go elsewhere. Our room had cobwebs in each corner, and mildew/mold growing around the window and on the ceiling in the bathroom. My daughter and I spent a lot of time in the pool, and the deck had not been swept in a long time. Used bandaids, hair, etc. all over. This made me start to think, how clean is the pool water? There are so many hotels in close proximity to Quality, you should be able to get a better room elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 4345 Southport Crossing Way, Indianapolis, IN 46237
